result.execSummary:
The defendant Alecya D Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration NOR the Substance Abuse Programs.

Conditions of Extended Supervision are the same as the Conditions of Probation.

miscConds.notes:
To be paid as a Condition of Probation/Extended Supervision; alternate  53 hours of Community Service.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Psychological Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Take a Criminal Thinking Course.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.
No contact with any Boston Store.
Provide DNA Sample If not yet provided and Pay Surcharge.
